Founded in 1906, Schnitzer Steel Industries is one of the larges recyclers of scrap metal in the United States. It is also one of the leading providers of used and recycled auto parts, as well as manufactures finished steel products. The company has three vertically integrated business units that provide metal recycling, steel manufacturing and used auto parts. It collects, trades, brokers, processes and recycles ferrous and nonferrous metal in more than 30 metal recycling facilities. The company operates a full-service used auto parts network that provides low-cost products to customers throughout the U.S., as well as Canada. Cascade Steel Rolling Mills, the steel manufacturing division of Schnitzer Steel Industries, purchases recycled metal and processes it into finished steel products, such as reinforcing bar, wire rod, merchant bar and various specialty products. Schnitzer Global Exchange, its subsidiary, is a trading company that provides scrap metal to global markets by purchasing processed ferrous metal from metal processors in the Baltic region and selling it to steel mills worldwide. Headquartered in Portland, Ore., Schnitzer Steel Industries maintains a location in Birmingham, Ala.

Established in Birmingham, AL in 1942, HRH Metals, Inc. has been a staple in the storied Birmingham steel history for the past 7 decades. HRH Metals, Inc. has grown from its original operation that employed 5 people, into it is current scope which spans scrap metal brokerage and processing around the globe. HRH business philosophy is simple: maximize performance, service and knowledge for the benefit of our customer and profitability will follow. We have always believed that to effectively carry out that philosophy, we must remain at a size that enables us to perform within a timeframe and with a quality that our larger competitors are simply unable to do. HRH Metals, Inc. has served the Birmingham Area since 1942. We Are a Recycling Facility Located in Moody Alabama. HRH Metals will process ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals including: copper, brass, aluminum, wire, lead, nickel, steel, cast iron, stainless steel, and batteries. Our expansion into global markets has increased as the emphasis on recycling and protecting the environment has become more widespread. Robinson had graduated from Auburn University in 1970, and was about to accept a position with a company in south Alabama when his father asked him if he would lend a hand at the family business for just six months during his grandfather illness. The younger Robinson found that he was perfectly suited for the brokering and marketing end of the business, and he remained there ever since. The third key player, the late Marlin Hinds, joined Hoffman and Robinson and became the other H in HRH Metals. Together, they grew the business from a small neighborhood operation to a major player in the metals processing and recycling business. In 2013, longtime and valued associate Steve Crawford became partners with Ed Robinson as co-owner of the company. Today HRH employs a staff of over 25 people, some of whom have over 40 years of service to the company.

Safety-Kleen Systems is one of the largest used oil recycling, parts cleaning and environmental solutions companies in North America. Commercial Waste Removal & Recycling Since 1929, Roll-off & Front Load Containers, Local Family Owned and Operated 205-424-2705

Established in Birmingham, AL in 1942, HRH Metals, Inc. has been a staple in the storied Birmingham steel history for the past 7 decades. HRH Metals, Inc. has grown from its original operation that employed 5 people, into it is current scope which spans scrap metal brokerage and processing around the globe. HRH business philosophy is simple: maximize performance, service and knowledge for the benefit of our customer and profitability will follow. We have always believed that to effectively carry out that philosophy, we must remain at a size that enables us to perform within a timeframe and with a quality that our larger competitors are simply unable to do. HRH Metals, Inc. has served the Birmingham Area since 1942. We Are a Recycling Facility Located in Moody Alabama. HRH Metals will process ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals including: copper, brass, aluminum, wire, lead, nickel, steel, cast iron, stainless steel, and batteries. Our expansion into global markets has increased as the emphasis on recycling and protecting the environment has become more widespread. Robinson had graduated from Auburn University in 1970, and was about to accept a position with a company in south Alabama when his father asked him if he would lend a hand at the family business for just six months during his grandfather illness. The younger Robinson found that he was perfectly suited for the brokering and marketing end of the business, and he remained there ever since. The third key player, the late Marlin Hinds, joined Hoffman and Robinson and became the other H in HRH Metals. Together, they grew the business from a small neighborhood operation to a major player in the metals processing and recycling business. In 2013, longtime and valued associate Steve Crawford became partners with Ed Robinson as co-owner of the company. Today HRH employs a staff of over 25 people, some of whom have over 40 years of service to the company.

Founded in 1906, Schnitzer Steel Industries is one of the larges recyclers of scrap metal in the United States. It is also one of the leading providers of used and recycled auto parts, as well as manufactures finished steel products. The company has three vertically integrated business units that provide metal recycling, steel manufacturing and used auto parts. It collects, trades, brokers, processes and recycles ferrous and nonferrous metal in more than 30 metal recycling facilities. The company operates a full-service used auto parts network that provides low-cost products to customers throughout the U.S., as well as Canada. Cascade Steel Rolling Mills, the steel manufacturing division of Schnitzer Steel Industries, purchases recycled metal and processes it into finished steel products, such as reinforcing bar, wire rod, merchant bar and various specialty products. Schnitzer Global Exchange, its subsidiary, is a trading company that provides scrap metal to global markets by purchasing processed ferrous metal from metal processors in the Baltic region and selling it to steel mills worldwide. Headquartered in Portland, Ore., Schnitzer Steel Industries maintains a location in Birmingham, Ala.

Established in Birmingham, AL in 1942, HRH Metals, Inc. has been a staple in the storied Birmingham steel history for the past 7 decades. HRH Metals, Inc. has grown from its original operation that employed 5 people, into it is current scope which spans scrap metal brokerage and processing around the globe. HRH business philosophy is simple: maximize performance, service and knowledge for the benefit of our customer and profitability will follow. We have always believed that to effectively carry out that philosophy, we must remain at a size that enables us to perform within a timeframe and with a quality that our larger competitors are simply unable to do. HRH Metals, Inc. has served the Birmingham Area since 1942. We Are a Recycling Facility Located in Moody Alabama. HRH Metals will process ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals including: copper, brass, aluminum, wire, lead, nickel, steel, cast iron, stainless steel, and batteries. Our expansion into global markets has increased as the emphasis on recycling and protecting the environment has become more widespread. Robinson had graduated from Auburn University in 1970, and was about to accept a position with a company in south Alabama when his father asked him if he would lend a hand at the family business for just six months during his grandfather illness. The younger Robinson found that he was perfectly suited for the brokering and marketing end of the business, and he remained there ever since. The third key player, the late Marlin Hinds, joined Hoffman and Robinson and became the other H in HRH Metals. Together, they grew the business from a small neighborhood operation to a major player in the metals processing and recycling business. In 2013, longtime and valued associate Steve Crawford became partners with Ed Robinson as co-owner of the company. Today HRH employs a staff of over 25 people, some of whom have over 40 years of service to the company.

Founded in 1906, Schnitzer Steel Industries is one of the larges recyclers of scrap metal in the United States. It is also one of the leading providers of used and recycled auto parts, as well as manufactures finished steel products. The company has three vertically integrated business units that provide metal recycling, steel manufacturing and used auto parts. It collects, trades, brokers, processes and recycles ferrous and nonferrous metal in more than 30 metal recycling facilities. The company operates a full-service used auto parts network that provides low-cost products to customers throughout the U.S., as well as Canada. Cascade Steel Rolling Mills, the steel manufacturing division of Schnitzer Steel Industries, purchases recycled metal and processes it into finished steel products, such as reinforcing bar, wire rod, merchant bar and various specialty products. Schnitzer Global Exchange, its subsidiary, is a trading company that provides scrap metal to global markets by purchasing processed ferrous metal from metal processors in the Baltic region and selling it to steel mills worldwide. Headquartered in Portland, Ore., Schnitzer Steel Industries maintains a location in Birmingham, Ala.

Robinson had graduated from Auburn University in 1970, and was about to accept a position with a company in south Alabama when his father asked him if he would lend a hand at the family business for just six months during his grandfather illness. The younger Robinson found that he was perfectly suited for the brokering and marketing end of the business, and he remained there ever since. The third key player, the late Marlin Hinds, joined Hoffman and Robinson and became the other H in HRH Metals. Together, they grew the business from a small neighborhood operation to a major player in the metals processing and recycling business. In 2013, longtime and valued associate Steve Crawford became partners with Ed Robinson as co-owner of the company. Today HRH employs a staff of over 25 people, some of whom have over 40 years of service to the company.

Founded in 1906, Schnitzer Steel Industries is one of the larges recyclers of scrap metal in the United States. It is also one of the leading providers of used and recycled auto parts, as well as manufactures finished steel products. The company has three vertically integrated business units that provide metal recycling, steel manufacturing and used auto parts. It collects, trades, brokers, processes and recycles ferrous and nonferrous metal in more than 30 metal recycling facilities. The company operates a full-service used auto parts network that provides low-cost products to customers throughout the U.S., as well as Canada. Cascade Steel Rolling Mills, the steel manufacturing division of Schnitzer Steel Industries, purchases recycled metal and processes it into finished steel products, such as reinforcing bar, wire rod, merchant bar and various specialty products. Schnitzer Global Exchange, its subsidiary, is a trading company that provides scrap metal to global markets by purchasing processed ferrous metal from metal processors in the Baltic region and selling it to steel mills worldwide. Headquartered in Portland, Ore., Schnitzer Steel Industries maintains a location in Birmingham, Ala.

Safety-Kleen Systems is one of the largest used oil recycling, parts cleaning and environmental solutions companies in North America. The company recycles more than 200 million gallons of used oil annually. It maintains a staff of over 4,200 employees. Safety-Kleen Systems serves nearly 330,000 customer locations in the United States, Canada and Mexico. The company offers oil products under the EcoPower brand. Commercial Waste Removal & Recycling Since 1929, Roll-off & Front Load Containers, Local Family Owned and Operated 205-424-2705

Established in Birmingham, AL in 1942, HRH Metals, Inc. has been a staple in the storied Birmingham steel history for the past 7 decades. HRH Metals, Inc. has grown from its original operation that employed 5 people, into it is current scope which spans scrap metal brokerage and processing around the globe. HRH business philosophy is simple: maximize performance, service and knowledge for the benefit of our customer and profitability will follow. We have always believed that to effectively carry out that philosophy, we must remain at a size that enables us to perform within a timeframe and with a quality that our larger competitors are simply unable to do. HRH Metals, Inc. has served the Birmingham Area since 1942. We Are a Recycling Facility Located in Moody Alabama. HRH Metals will process ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals including: copper, brass, aluminum, wire, lead, nickel, steel, cast iron, stainless steel, and batteries. Our expansion into global markets has increased as the emphasis on recycling and protecting the environment has become more widespread. Robinson had graduated from Auburn University in 1970, and was about to accept a position with a company in south Alabama when his father asked him if he would lend a hand at the family business for just six months during his grandfather illness. The younger Robinson found that he was perfectly suited for the brokering and marketing end of the business, and he remained there ever since. The third key player, the late Marlin Hinds, joined Hoffman and Robinson and became the other H in HRH Metals. Together, they grew the business from a small neighborhood operation to a major player in the metals processing and recycling business. In 2013, longtime and valued associate Steve Crawford became partners with Ed Robinson as co-owner of the company. Today HRH employs a staff of over 25 people, some of whom have over 40 years of service to the company.

Founded in 1906, Schnitzer Steel Industries is one of the larges recyclers of scrap metal in the United States. It is also one of the leading providers of used and recycled auto parts, as well as manufactures finished steel products. The company has three vertically integrated business units that provide metal recycling, steel manufacturing and used auto parts. It collects, trades, brokers, processes and recycles ferrous and nonferrous metal in more than 30 metal recycling facilities. The company operates a full-service used auto parts network that provides low-cost products to customers throughout the U.S., as well as Canada. Cascade Steel Rolling Mills, the steel manufacturing division of Schnitzer Steel Industries, purchases recycled metal and processes it into finished steel products, such as reinforcing bar, wire rod, merchant bar and various specialty products. Schnitzer Global Exchange, its subsidiary, is a trading company that provides scrap metal to global markets by purchasing processed ferrous metal from metal processors in the Baltic region and selling it to steel mills worldwide. Headquartered in Portland, Ore., Schnitzer Steel Industries maintains a location in Birmingham, Ala.

Established in Birmingham, AL in 1942, HRH Metals, Inc. has been a staple in the storied Birmingham steel history for the past 7 decades. HRH Metals, Inc. has grown from its original operation that employed 5 people, into it is current scope which spans scrap metal brokerage and processing around the globe. HRH business philosophy is simple: maximize performance, service and knowledge for the benefit of our customer and profitability will follow. We have always believed that to effectively carry out that philosophy, we must remain at a size that enables us to perform within a timeframe and with a quality that our larger competitors are simply unable to do. HRH Metals, Inc. has served the Birmingham Area since 1942. We Are a Recycling Facility Located in Moody Alabama. HRH Metals will process ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals including: copper, brass, aluminum, wire, lead, nickel, steel, cast iron, stainless steel, and batteries. Our expansion into global markets has increased as the emphasis on recycling and protecting the environment has become more widespread. Robinson had graduated from Auburn University in 1970, and was about to accept a position with a company in south Alabama when his father asked him if he would lend a hand at the family business for just six months during his grandfather illness. The younger Robinson found that he was perfectly suited for the brokering and marketing end of the business, and he remained there ever since. The third key player, the late Marlin Hinds, joined Hoffman and Robinson and became the other H in HRH Metals. Together, they grew the business from a small neighborhood operation to a major player in the metals processing and recycling business. In 2013, longtime and valued associate Steve Crawford became partners with Ed Robinson as co-owner of the company. Today HRH employs a staff of over 25 people, some of whom have over 40 years of service to the company.

Founded in 1906, Schnitzer Steel Industries is one of the larges recyclers of scrap metal in the United States. It is also one of the leading providers of used and recycled auto parts, as well as manufactures finished steel products. The company has three vertically integrated business units that provide metal recycling, steel manufacturing and used auto parts. It collects, trades, brokers, processes and recycles ferrous and nonferrous metal in more than 30 metal recycling facilities. The company operates a full-service used auto parts network that provides low-cost products to customers throughout the U.S., as well as Canada. Cascade Steel Rolling Mills, the steel manufacturing division of Schnitzer Steel Industries, purchases recycled metal and processes it into finished steel products, such as reinforcing bar, wire rod, merchant bar and various specialty products. Schnitzer Global Exchange, its subsidiary, is a trading company that provides scrap metal to global markets by purchasing processed ferrous metal from metal processors in the Baltic region and selling it to steel mills worldwide. Headquartered in Portland, Ore., Schnitzer Steel Industries maintains a location in Birmingham, Ala.

Founded in 1906, Schnitzer Steel Industries is one of the larges recyclers of scrap metal in the United States. It is also one of the leading providers of used and recycled auto parts, as well as manufactures finished steel products. The company has three vertically integrated business units that provide metal recycling, steel manufacturing and used auto parts. It collects, trades, brokers, processes and recycles ferrous and nonferrous metal in more than 30 metal recycling facilities. The company operates a full-service used auto parts network that provides low-cost products to customers throughout the U.S., as well as Canada. Cascade Steel Rolling Mills, the steel manufacturing division of Schnitzer Steel Industries, purchases recycled metal and processes it into finished steel products, such as reinforcing bar, wire rod, merchant bar and various specialty products. Schnitzer Global Exchange, its subsidiary, is a trading company that provides scrap metal to global markets by purchasing processed ferrous metal from metal processors in the Baltic region and selling it to steel mills worldwide. Headquartered in Portland, Ore., Schnitzer Steel Industries maintains a location in Birmingham, Ala.

Established in Birmingham, AL in 1942, HRH Metals, Inc. has been a staple in the storied Birmingham steel history for the past 7 decades. HRH Metals, Inc. has grown from its original operation that employed 5 people, into it is current scope which spans scrap metal brokerage and processing around the globe. HRH business philosophy is simple: maximize performance, service and knowledge for the benefit of our customer and profitability will follow. We have always believed that to effectively carry out that philosophy, we must remain at a size that enables us to perform within a timeframe and with a quality that our larger competitors are simply unable to do. HRH Metals, Inc. has served the Birmingham Area since 1942. We Are a Recycling Facility Located in Moody Alabama. HRH Metals will process ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals including: copper, brass, aluminum, wire, lead, nickel, steel, cast iron, stainless steel, and batteries. Our expansion into global markets has increased as the emphasis on recycling and protecting the environment has become more widespread. Robinson had graduated from Auburn University in 1970, and was about to accept a position with a company in south Alabama when his father asked him if he would lend a hand at the family business for just six months during his grandfather illness. The younger Robinson found that he was perfectly suited for the brokering and marketing end of the business, and he remained there ever since. The third key player, the late Marlin Hinds, joined Hoffman and Robinson and became the other H in HRH Metals. Together, they grew the business from a small neighborhood operation to a major player in the metals processing and recycling business. In 2013, longtime and valued associate Steve Crawford became partners with Ed Robinson as co-owner of the company. Today HRH employs a staff of over 25 people, some of whom have over 40 years of service to the company.

Safety-Kleen Systems is one of the largest used oil recycling, parts cleaning and environmental solutions companies in North America. Commercial Waste Removal & Recycling Since 1929, Roll-off & Front Load Containers, Local Family Owned and Operated 205-424-2705

Established in Birmingham, AL in 1942, HRH Metals, Inc. has been a staple in the storied Birmingham steel history for the past 7 decades. HRH Metals, Inc. has grown from its original operation that employed 5 people, into it is current scope which spans scrap metal brokerage and processing around the globe. HRH business philosophy is simple: maximize performance, service and knowledge for the benefit of our customer and profitability will follow. We have always believed that to effectively carry out that philosophy, we must remain at a size that enables us to perform within a timeframe and with a quality that our larger competitors are simply unable to do. HRH Metals, Inc. has served the Birmingham Area since 1942. We Are a Recycling Facility Located in Moody Alabama. HRH Metals will process ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals including: copper, brass, aluminum, wire, lead, nickel, steel, cast iron, stainless steel, and batteries. Our expansion into global markets has increased as the emphasis on recycling and protecting the environment has become more widespread. Robinson had graduated from Auburn University in 1970, and was about to accept a position with a company in south Alabama when his father asked him if he would lend a hand at the family business for just six months during his grandfather illness. The younger Robinson found that he was perfectly suited for the brokering and marketing end of the business, and he remained there ever since. The third key player, the late Marlin Hinds, joined Hoffman and Robinson and became the other H in HRH Metals. Together, they grew the business from a small neighborhood operation to a major player in the metals processing and recycling business. In 2013, longtime and valued associate Steve Crawford became partners with Ed Robinson as co-owner of the company. Today HRH employs a staff of over 25 people, some of whom have over 40 years of service to the company.

Founded in 1906, Schnitzer Steel Industries is one of the larges recyclers of scrap metal in the United States. It is also one of the leading providers of used and recycled auto parts, as well as manufactures finished steel products. The company has three vertically integrated business units that provide metal recycling, steel manufacturing and used auto parts. It collects, trades, brokers, processes and recycles ferrous and nonferrous metal in more than 30 metal recycling facilities. The company operates a full-service used auto parts network that provides low-cost products to customers throughout the U.S., as well as Canada. Cascade Steel Rolling Mills, the steel manufacturing division of Schnitzer Steel Industries, purchases recycled metal and processes it into finished steel products, such as reinforcing bar, wire rod, merchant bar and various specialty products. Schnitzer Global Exchange, its subsidiary, is a trading company that provides scrap metal to global markets by purchasing processed ferrous metal from metal processors in the Baltic region and selling it to steel mills worldwide. Headquartered in Portland, Ore., Schnitzer Steel Industries maintains a location in Birmingham, Ala.

Established in Birmingham, AL in 1942, HRH Metals, Inc. has been a staple in the storied Birmingham steel history for the past 7 decades. HRH Metals, Inc. has grown from its original operation that employed 5 people, into it is current scope which spans scrap metal brokerage and processing around the globe. HRH business philosophy is simple: maximize performance, service and knowledge for the benefit of our customer and profitability will follow. We have always believed that to effectively carry out that philosophy, we must remain at a size that enables us to perform within a timeframe and with a quality that our larger competitors are simply unable to do. HRH Metals, Inc. has served the Birmingham Area since 1942. We Are a Recycling Facility Located in Moody Alabama. HRH Metals will process ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals including: copper, brass, aluminum, wire, lead, nickel, steel, cast iron, stainless steel, and batteries. Our expansion into global markets has increased as the emphasis on recycling and protecting the environment has become more widespread. Robinson had graduated from Auburn University in 1970, and was about to accept a position with a company in south Alabama when his father asked him if he would lend a hand at the family business for just six months during his grandfather illness. The younger Robinson found that he was perfectly suited for the brokering and marketing end of the business, and he remained there ever since. The third key player, the late Marlin Hinds, joined Hoffman and Robinson and became the other H in HRH Metals. Together, they grew the business from a small neighborhood operation to a major player in the metals processing and recycling business. In 2013, longtime and valued associate Steve Crawford became partners with Ed Robinson as co-owner of the company. Today HRH employs a staff of over 25 people, some of whom have over 40 years of service to the company.

Founded in 1906, Schnitzer Steel Industries is one of the larges recyclers of scrap metal in the United States. It is also one of the leading providers of used and recycled auto parts, as well as manufactures finished steel products. The company has three vertically integrated business units that provide metal recycling, steel manufacturing and used auto parts. It collects, trades, brokers, processes and recycles ferrous and nonferrous metal in more than 30 metal recycling facilities. The company operates a full-service used auto parts network that provides low-cost products to customers throughout the U.S., as well as Canada. Cascade Steel Rolling Mills, the steel manufacturing division of Schnitzer Steel Industries, purchases recycled metal and processes it into finished steel products, such as reinforcing bar, wire rod, merchant bar and various specialty products. Schnitzer Global Exchange, its subsidiary, is a trading company that provides scrap metal to global markets by purchasing processed ferrous metal from metal processors in the Baltic region and selling it to steel mills worldwide. Headquartered in Portland, Ore., Schnitzer Steel Industries maintains a location in Birmingham, Ala.

Founded in 1906, Schnitzer Steel Industries is one of the larges recyclers of scrap metal in the United States. It is also one of the leading providers of used and recycled auto parts, as well as manufactures finished steel products. The company has three vertically integrated business units that provide metal recycling, steel manufacturing and used auto parts. It collects, trades, brokers, processes and recycles ferrous and nonferrous metal in more than 30 metal recycling facilities. The company operates a full-service used auto parts network that provides low-cost products to customers throughout the U.S., as well as Canada. Cascade Steel Rolling Mills, the steel manufacturing division of Schnitzer Steel Industries, purchases recycled metal and processes it into finished steel products, such as reinforcing bar, wire rod, merchant bar and various specialty products. Schnitzer Global Exchange, its subsidiary, is a trading company that provides scrap metal to global markets by purchasing processed ferrous metal from metal processors in the Baltic region and selling it to steel mills worldwide. Headquartered in Portland, Ore., Schnitzer Steel Industries maintains a location in Birmingham, Ala.

Commercial Waste Removal & Recycling Since 1929, Roll-off & Front Load Containers, Local Family Owned and Operated 205-424-2705

Established in Birmingham, AL in 1942, HRH Metals, Inc. has been a staple in the storied Birmingham steel history for the past 7 decades. HRH Metals, Inc. has grown from its original operation that employed 5 people, into it is current scope which spans scrap metal brokerage and processing around the globe. HRH business philosophy is simple: maximize performance, service and knowledge for the benefit of our customer and profitability will follow. We have always believed that to effectively carry out that philosophy, we must remain at a size that enables us to perform within a timeframe and with a quality that our larger competitors are simply unable to do. HRH Metals, Inc. has served the Birmingham Area since 1942. We Are a Recycling Facility Located in Moody Alabama. HRH Metals will process ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals including: copper, brass, aluminum, wire, lead, nickel, steel, cast iron, stainless steel, and batteries. Our expansion into global markets has increased as the emphasis on recycling and protecting the environment has become more widespread. Robinson had graduated from Auburn University in 1970, and was about to accept a position with a company in south Alabama when his father asked him if he would lend a hand at the family business for just six months during his grandfather illness. The younger Robinson found that he was perfectly suited for the brokering and marketing end of the business, and he remained there ever since. The third key player, the late Marlin Hinds, joined Hoffman and Robinson and became the other H in HRH Metals. Together, they grew the business from a small neighborhood operation to a major player in the metals processing and recycling business. In 2013, longtime and valued associate Steve Crawford became partners with Ed Robinson as co-owner of the company. Today HRH employs a staff of over 25 people, some of whom have over 40 years of service to the company.

Commercial Waste Removal & Recycling Since 1929, Roll-off & Front Load Containers, Local Family Owned and Operated 205-424-2705

Established in Birmingham, AL in 1942, HRH Metals, Inc. has been a staple in the storied Birmingham steel history for the past 7 decades. HRH Metals, Inc. has grown from its original operation that employed 5 people, into it is current scope which spans scrap metal brokerage and processing around the globe. HRH business philosophy is simple: maximize performance, service and knowledge for the benefit of our customer and profitability will follow. We have always believed that to effectively carry out that philosophy, we must remain at a size that enables us to perform within a timeframe and with a quality that our larger competitors are simply unable to do. HRH Metals, Inc. has served the Birmingham Area since 1942. We Are a Recycling Facility Located in Moody Alabama. HRH Metals will process ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals including: copper, brass, aluminum, wire, lead, nickel, steel, cast iron, stainless steel, and batteries. Our expansion into global markets has increased as the emphasis on recycling and protecting the environment has become more widespread. Robinson had graduated from Auburn University in 1970, and was about to accept a position with a company in south Alabama when his father asked him if he would lend a hand at the family business for just six months during his grandfather illness. The younger Robinson found that he was perfectly suited for the brokering and marketing end of the business, and he remained there ever since. The third key player, the late Marlin Hinds, joined Hoffman and Robinson and became the other H in HRH Metals. Together, they grew the business from a small neighborhood operation to a major player in the metals processing and recycling business. In 2013, longtime and valued associate Steve Crawford became partners with Ed Robinson as co-owner of the company. Today HRH employs a staff of over 25 people, some of whom have over 40 years of service to the company.

Founded in 1906, Schnitzer Steel Industries is one of the larges recyclers of scrap metal in the United States. It is also one of the leading providers of used and recycled auto parts, as well as manufactures finished steel products. The company has three vertically integrated business units that provide metal recycling, steel manufacturing and used auto parts. It collects, trades, brokers, processes and recycles ferrous and nonferrous metal in more than 30 metal recycling facilities. The company operates a full-service used auto parts network that provides low-cost products to customers throughout the U.S., as well as Canada. Cascade Steel Rolling Mills, the steel manufacturing division of Schnitzer Steel Industries, purchases recycled metal and processes it into finished steel products, such as reinforcing bar, wire rod, merchant bar and various specialty products. Schnitzer Global Exchange, its subsidiary, is a trading company that provides scrap metal to global markets by purchasing processed ferrous metal from metal processors in the Baltic region and selling it to steel mills worldwide. Headquartered in Portland, Ore., Schnitzer Steel Industries maintains a location in Birmingham, Ala.

Established in Birmingham, AL in 1942, HRH Metals, Inc. has been a staple in the storied Birmingham steel history for the past 7 decades. HRH Metals, Inc. has grown from its original operation that employed 5 people, into it is current scope which spans scrap metal brokerage and processing around the globe. HRH business philosophy is simple: maximize performance, service and knowledge for the benefit of our customer and profitability will follow. We have always believed that to effectively carry out that philosophy, we must remain at a size that enables us to perform within a timeframe and with a quality that our larger competitors are simply unable to do. HRH Metals, Inc. has served the Birmingham Area since 1942. We Are a Recycling Facility Located in Moody Alabama. HRH Metals will process ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals including: copper, brass, aluminum, wire, lead, nickel, steel, cast iron, stainless steel, and batteries. Our expansion into global markets has increased as the emphasis on recycling and protecting the environment has become more widespread. Robinson had graduated from Auburn University in 1970, and was about to accept a position with a company in south Alabama when his father asked him if he would lend a hand at the family business for just six months during his grandfather illness. The younger Robinson found that he was perfectly suited for the brokering and marketing end of the business, and he remained there ever since. The third key player, the late Marlin Hinds, joined Hoffman and Robinson and became the other H in HRH Metals. Together, they grew the business from a small neighborhood operation to a major player in the metals processing and recycling business. In 2013, longtime and valued associate Steve Crawford became partners with Ed Robinson as co-owner of the company. Today HRH employs a staff of over 25 people, some of whom have over 40 years of service to the company.

Founded in 1906, Schnitzer Steel Industries is one of the larges recyclers of scrap metal in the United States. It is also one of the leading providers of used and recycled auto parts, as well as manufactures finished steel products. The company has three vertically integrated business units that provide metal recycling, steel manufacturing and used auto parts. It collects, trades, brokers, processes and recycles ferrous and nonferrous metal in more than 30 metal recycling facilities. The company operates a full-service used auto parts network that provides low-cost products to customers throughout the U.S., as well as Canada. Cascade Steel Rolling Mills, the steel manufacturing division of Schnitzer Steel Industries, purchases recycled metal and processes it into finished steel products, such as reinforcing bar, wire rod, merchant bar and various specialty products. Schnitzer Global Exchange, its subsidiary, is a trading company that provides scrap metal to global markets by purchasing processed ferrous metal from metal processors in the Baltic region and selling it to steel mills worldwide. Headquartered in Portland, Ore., Schnitzer Steel Industries maintains a location in Birmingham, Ala.

Safety-Kleen Systems is one of the largest used oil recycling, parts cleaning and environmental solutions companies in North America. The company recycles more than 200 million gallons of used oil annually. It maintains a staff of over 4,200 employees. Safety-Kleen Systems serves nearly 330,000 customer locations in the United States, Canada and Mexico. The company offers oil products under the EcoPower brand. It provides coolants and windshield washers. Safety-Kleen Systems also offers several cleaning products, such as wipes, absorbents, aerosols and hand cleaners. The company provides waste management, emergency response and oil collection services. It serves the automotive, industrial, manufacturing, government, education and medical sectors.

Commercial Waste Removal & Recycling Since 1929, Roll-off & Front Load Containers, Local Family Owned and Operated 205-424-2705

Established in Birmingham, AL in 1942, HRH Metals, Inc. has been a staple in the storied Birmingham steel history for the past 7 decades. HRH Metals, Inc. has grown from its original operation that employed 5 people, into it is current scope which spans scrap metal brokerage and processing around the globe. HRH business philosophy is simple: maximize performance, service and knowledge for the benefit of our customer and profitability will follow. We have always believed that to effectively carry out that philosophy, we must remain at a size that enables us to perform within a timeframe and with a quality that our larger competitors are simply unable to do. HRH Metals, Inc. has served the Birmingham Area since 1942. We Are a Recycling Facility Located in Moody Alabama. HRH Metals will process ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals including: copper, brass, aluminum, wire, lead, nickel, steel, cast iron, stainless steel, and batteries. Our expansion into global markets has increased as the emphasis on recycling and protecting the environment has become more widespread. Robinson had graduated from Auburn University in 1970, and was about to accept a position with a company in south Alabama when his father asked him if he would lend a hand at the family business for just six months during his grandfather illness. The younger Robinson found that he was perfectly suited for the brokering and marketing end of the business, and he remained there ever since. The third key player, the late Marlin Hinds, joined Hoffman and Robinson and became the other H in HRH Metals. Together, they grew the business from a small neighborhood operation to a major player in the metals processing and recycling business. In 2013, longtime and valued associate Steve Crawford became partners with Ed Robinson as co-owner of the company. Today HRH employs a staff of over 25 people, some of whom have over 40 years of service to the company.

Founded in 1906, Schnitzer Steel Industries is one of the larges recyclers of scrap metal in the United States. It is also one of the leading providers of used and recycled auto parts, as well as manufactures finished steel products. The company has three vertically integrated business units that provide metal recycling, steel manufacturing and used auto parts. It collects, trades, brokers, processes and recycles ferrous and nonferrous metal in more than 30 metal recycling facilities. The company operates a full-service used auto parts network that provides low-cost products to customers throughout the U.S., as well as Canada. Cascade Steel Rolling Mills, the steel manufacturing division of Schnitzer Steel Industries, purchases recycled metal and processes it into finished steel products, such as reinforcing bar, wire rod, merchant bar and various specialty products. Schnitzer Global Exchange, its subsidiary, is a trading company that provides scrap metal to global markets by purchasing processed ferrous metal from metal processors in the Baltic region and selling it to steel mills worldwide. Headquartered in Portland, Ore., Schnitzer Steel Industries maintains a location in Birmingham, Ala.

Safety-Kleen Systems is one of the largest used oil recycling, parts cleaning and environmental solutions companies in North America. The company recycles more than 200 million gallons of used oil annually. It maintains a staff of over 4,200 employees. Safety-Kleen Systems serves nearly 330,000 customer locations in the United States, Canada and Mexico. The company offers oil products under the EcoPower brand. It provides coolants and windshield washers. Safety-Kleen Systems also offers several cleaning products, such as wipes, absorbents, aerosols and hand cleaners. The company provides waste management, emergency response and oil collection services. It serves the automotive, industrial, manufacturing, government, education and medical sectors.

Established in Birmingham, AL in 1942, HRH Metals, Inc. has been a staple in the storied Birmingham steel history for the past 7 decades. HRH Metals, Inc. has grown from its original operation that employed 5 people, into it is current scope which spans scrap metal brokerage and processing around the globe. HRH business philosophy is simple: maximize performance, service and knowledge for the benefit of our customer and profitability will follow. We have always believed that to effectively carry out that philosophy, we must remain at a size that enables us to perform within a timeframe and with a quality that our larger competitors are simply unable to do. HRH Metals, Inc. has served the Birmingham Area since 1942. We Are a Recycling Facility Located in Moody Alabama. HRH Metals will process ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals including: copper, brass, aluminum, wire, lead, nickel, steel, cast iron, stainless steel, and batteries. Our expansion into global markets has increased as the emphasis on recycling and protecting the environment has become more widespread. Robinson had graduated from Auburn University in 1970, and was about to accept a position with a company in south Alabama when his father asked him if he would lend a hand at the family business for just six months during his grandfather illness. The younger Robinson found that he was perfectly suited for the brokering and marketing end of the business, and he remained there ever since. The third key player, the late Marlin Hinds, joined Hoffman and Robinson and became the other H in HRH Metals. Together, they grew the business from a small neighborhood operation to a major player in the metals processing and recycling business. In 2013, longtime and valued associate Steve Crawford became partners with Ed Robinson as co-owner of the company. Today HRH employs a staff of over 25 people, some of whom have over 40 years of service to the company.
